compounddef.title: How to Configure, Build, and Run the cFE
compounddef.innerpage: Configure the Build Directory for a Mission
Configure the cFE Core for Each CPU Directory
Configure a Set of cFE Applications for Each CPU
Build the cFE Core and cFE Applications
Load and Run the cFE Core and cFE Applications

detaileddescription.para: IMPORTANT NOTE: This method of building the cFE is not recommended for use with CFS applications. For building the cFE and CFS applications, refer to the CFS Deployment Guide which is located in the CFS repository.

The cFE development environment has been designed to isolate the reusable cFE source code from the cFE applications, configuration parameters, and build products. The following sections provide instructions on how to:
Setup the Build Environment
Setup the cFE Source Distribution
Create System Environment Variables
Configure the Build Directory for a Mission
Configure the cFE Core for Each CPU Directory
Configure a Set of cFE Applications for Each CPU
Configure the Application Directories in each CPU Directory
Configure the makefile in each CPU Directory
Configure the mission and CPU specific cFE Application Parameter files
Build the cFE Core and cFE Applications
Load and Run the cFE Core and cFE Applications
Load the cFE Core Executable on the Target
Setup the Target File Systems
Transfer the cFE Applications and Startup File to the Target Non-Volatile Disk
Description of Fields in the Startup script
Start the cFE Core on the Target
Next: Target Specific Instructions Up To: cFE Deployment Guide
